meanings.definition: Capable of being moved or easily moved.
meanings.sent1: The small toy car was very moble, able to glide effortlessly across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The lightweight suitcase was designed to be moble for travelers on the go.
meanings.sent3: The moble puppy kept running around the house, making it hard to catch.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas were so moble, constantly changing and evolving with each new inspiration.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements were incredibly moble, flowing gracefully from one pose to another.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture that can be easily moved.
meanings.sent1: The office had a moble with wheels, making it convenient to rearrange the room.
meanings.sent2: She bought a new moble for her living room, allowing her to change the layout whenever she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The moble in the bedroom seemed to have a mind of its own, sliding across the floor when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were like a moble, shifting and adapting to different situations effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The antique moble in the corner of the room added a touch of elegance to the space.

meanings.sent1: She always carries her moble with her, never wanting to miss an important call.
meanings.sent2: The latest moble on the market has a high-resolution screen and advanced features.
meanings.sent3: The moble rang loudly during the meeting, causing everyone to turn and look.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a constantly buzzing moble, filled with notifications and alerts.
meanings.sent5: The moble allowed him to stay connected to his friends and family no matter where he traveled.
